description: Clinical blood panel analysis with severity, urgency, and temporal relevance axes. Uses LAB colorspace for perceptually uniform severity metrics.

transform.notes: LAB provides perceptually uniform distances suitable for clinical severity metrics

L.label: Clinical Severity
L.description: Overall clinical concern level from routine (0) to critical (100)
L.interpretation: Higher values indicate greater medical concern requiring attention

a.label: Urgency Level
a.description: Time-sensitivity axis from routine monitoring (negative) to immediate action (positive)
a.interpretation: Negative values: routine/scheduled. Positive values: time-sensitive/urgent.

b.label: Temporal Relevance
b.interpretation: Negative: stable baseline. Positive: acute change or concerning trend.

anchors.label: Routine Annual Screening
anchors.description: Normal preventive care with no immediate concerns
anchors.semantic_context: Annual physical, wellness check, no red flags

anchors.label: Chronic Condition Monitoring (Stable)
anchors.description: Existing condition with stable baseline, routine follow-up
anchors.semantic_context: Diabetes monitoring, hypertension check, stable readings

anchors.label: Chronic Condition with Emerging Concern
anchors.description: Known condition with values trending outside normal range
anchors.semantic_context: Elevated glucose trend, rising cholesterol, needs attention

anchors.label: Moderate Clinical Concern
anchors.description: Abnormal values requiring medical consultation within days
anchors.semantic_context: Borderline anemia, liver enzyme elevation, schedule appointment

anchors.label: Acute Clinical Concern
anchors.description: Significantly abnormal values requiring immediate medical attention
anchors.semantic_context: Critical blood sugar, severe anemia, immediate doctor notification

quality_config.notes: High thresholds appropriate for medical context where low-confidence interpretations should flag for manual review

confidence_factors.notes: Balanced weighting between transform quality, schema coverage, and proximity to known anchors

compliance_notes: This schema is designed for use in HIPAA-compliant systems. All interpretations must be logged with complete audit trails including schema version and confidence scores.

usage_guidelines.integration_notes: VRGB interpretations should supplement, not replace, clinical judgment. Always display confidence scores to clinicians.

version_history.changes: Added urgency dimension, 3 total anchors, refined ranges
Added temporal relevance dimension, increased to 4 anchors
Final production schema with 5 anchors, comprehensive coverage, Merkle-style hashing support, enhanced documentation
